eventName: The birth of the Holy Virgin Mary
eventDesc: he birth of the Holy Virgin Mary is celebrated on the first day of the month. St. Jacob and St. Hanna had no children, when they asked God through fasting and prayer, give them the Holy Virgin Mary, who gave birth to our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, who is the salvation of the world.

Saint Raguel, the archangel, is one of the nine archangels, and on September 1st, he was appointed as the chief of angels with honor and grace. He is celebrated by the Ethiopian Orthodox Church. We can clearly see in chapter 6 of the book of Enoch that this holy angel interpreted the nature of the sun to the prophet Enoch. Saint Raguel, the archangel, is the steward of the lights and has been given the absolute authority to avenge and punish the devil, the ruler of the darkness of this world.

The Holy Church honors Saint Elias after the great prophets, Saint Moses. She calls him 'the head of the prophets'. For he is the father who stops the sessional rainfall, made the fire rain to the ground, and commanded creation with his word. What is this passable? His holy generation (tribe) is Israel (the ten tribes) from whom Jeroboam took them apart, and his father is called 'Iasnu' and his mother is called 'Tonnah'. Because they truly worshiped God, God sanctified 'Tonnah' womb and created this holy fruit. On the day of Saint Ilyas's birth, his house was seen filled with light. Four men (angels) clothed in light came and wrapped him in a mantle of fire. But the priests asked, 'What kind of creation will it be? Will he reign in Israel! Or will he be a prophet?' They praised him. St. Elias is an Israelite who loves cleanliness and is serious since his childhood.

According to the order of the Holy Church, Ethiopian new year is celebrated on the first day of September. it is named after Saint John, it also includes the days from September one to eight. At this time, the hymn sung in the holy church is about the celebration of St. John and the new year. A sermon is preached that refers to the teaching and fight of St. John. And the lesson is given. The reason why New Year's Day is named after Saint John the Baptist: 1. Since the action of St. John the Baptist is the starting point for the modern gospel 2. Saint John the Baptist is the title of righteous martyrs

The righteous Job was cured of his disease on this day. Since the righteous Job was washed in running water and was cured of all his diseases, it has become a custom for people that when the year comes to an end, they are baptized with fresh water all the time, and they are blessed by it.

On this day, the image of the Virgin Mary, who was painted by Saint Luke and clothed in flesh, on which her face in the paint glow and is known to heal the sick, was brought to Tsedenia from her friend, Martha of the Blessed Sacrament. She could not sleep because of her love for the mother of light( Holy Virgin Mary). She used to serve her diligently. When the Ethiopian monk Abba Tewodros, who she sent to bring her painting, tried to take it for himself when he saw the miracles of her painting. (What should he do! I would have done the same thing if it were me.) But it was shown that Martha is the one who loved Holy Virgin Mary more, since the paint is found at Tsedenia house on this day by a wonderful miracle.

Saint Stephen was one of the Israelites who had an amazing identity in the first century CE. Saint Stephen's parents were Simon and Mary. (There are others who say they are.) The saint, who was serious from his childhood, grew up in the Torah and entered school when he was old enough. The great teacher of the time was called Gamaliel. Stephen learned from this scholar and became well versed in the Torah and the Prophets. Although the time was difficult and conducive to a life of sin, the saint was waiting for the coming of the Messiah with prayer and hope. At that time, Saint Stephen, who saw John the Baptist preaching the baptism of repentance, he investigated the matter. since he found it to be from God, he became a disciple of John the Baptist. He diligently served Saint John for six months. After learning from Saint John for six months, he bowed to his name and was baptized by our Lord Jesus Christ. St. Stephen, who had sean the great miracle at made by Lord Jesus and taken the lesons to his heart, asked his teacher, St. John, to explain it to him. and St. John said 'you should hear it from the mouth of the Creator rather than from me.' He then sent him to to The holy man went to the Lord and learned with his hands raised. (Luke 7:18) And there he remained a disciple of the Lord. The Lord made him one of the seventy-two Ardent and sent him to serve. And the demons obeyed him. (Luke 10:17) Saint Stephen, our Lord, learned the gospel from Lord Jesus Christ him self by spending his day and night with him. He interpreted the mystery of Lord willingly dieing for us and rising again, he blessed his disciples with an opportunity. At this time, the saint was appointed to the priesthood like his brothers the apostles. When the Holy Spirit descended on the Feast of Pentecost, none of the seventy-two Ardeat had as many tongues as him, and no one had secrets revealed to him as much as Saint Stephen. He went in to preach the gospel with absolute courage. He was one of the seven deacons chosen by the Holy Spirit when the church was challenged in the early days. and more he became the head of the six deacons and the leader (administrator) of the congregation of eight thousand.

Glory be to the previous fathers who paid the necessary spiritual and physical price and brought us the Ark of Zion and the Holy Cross. On this day, we commemorate the resting of the cross of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ on Deber Kerbe Geshe. In other words, the good Emperor David  of Ethiopia continued the effort started by Seif Arad, and by the power of God, he shocked the nations and asked Holy Virgin Mary in prayer. The Mother of God helped them, and the Holy Cross was sent to them. He accepted the cross on the 10th of September, celebrated the festival with joy and rested on the road in 1366 AD(Ethiopian Calendar). After the death of Emperor David of Ethiopia, the Holy Cross was placed for thirty years. More than six kings passed until the reign of Emperor Zara Jacob in 1426 AD (Ethiopian Calendar). A few years after the reign of Emperor Zara Jacob, when the king was thinking of building a church in Debre Berhan for the Holy Cross, our Lord said in a vision, 'Place Cross in A Mountain of Cross'. From this day, the good king worked hard with his army to find the place of the blessed cross. Finally, ten years after his reign, he met Geshen in Ambasal (Wolo) Ethiopia and made him happy. Because this place was chosen by the will of the Trinity, God the Father lifted up the church and covered the cross with iron, copper, brass, silver and gold and placed it so that it would not touch the soil. Miracles were performed there. The righteous Zera Jacob wrote a book called 'Tafut' and placed it there. According to the book, the cross in our country is not segment of the cross (right hand), but the whole cross. This was done on September 21.

Saint Athanasius, who was born and raised in Syria, was known for his piousness, and his life was full of chastity. Ages have passed since he entered a monastery and dedicated his body to God. At that time, the Patriarch of Antioch was resting, so they went around the desert looking for someone who was worthy of the seat. But they never found a better man than St. Athanasius. They brought him to the city because he was a good shepherd who knew the books well and had compassion for his flock. According to the culture of their country, the archbishops are appointed by the bishops of all the dioceses, so they waited. Everyone was present, but Father Ilmefrian, who was the bishop of Selek in Syria, was late. After waiting for fifty days, they appointed Father Athanasios as 'Patriarch of Antioch' and separated. On the fifty-first day, when Father Ilmefrian arrived, he was angry when they told him that the festival was over. 'Anyone who calls Athanasius a patriarch will be damned, for he who is appointed does not work in my absence.' He went back to laughing. St. Athanasius was very sad when he heard this. He did not come seeking the position, but they forced him to do so. Just as we see in his time, the saint can condemn him back. But the saint did not like to see the church and the devotees being divided for the sake of his personal glory. He called his disciple and said, 'My son! Say yes to me, my soul will bless you. I will be on the road for a year, so you  work like me. If the people ask you, tell them that he has gone to the monastery.' after saying that he left the papacy. He walked for a day and arrived in Selek, wearing his very dirty Desert clothes. He went to Abba Ilmefrian and prostrated before him. 'my father! 'I have nothing am passing by, would you allow me stay here?' he begged. Abba Ilmefrian allowed him to live with the monks. St. Athanasius, the patriarch, entered serving with his loins girded. He fetches water, bakes bread, sweeps houses, cleans toilets, washes the monks' feet. With all this, his sweat was dripping down his body. When the fathers saw his diligence and humility, they nominated him for deaconship. The bishop called and said, 'Let me appoint you a deacon.' Patriarch Saint Athanasius cried. 'What?' He said, 'Father! I have been appointed as a deacon before.' then After seven months of noticing him they asked him to be ordained as a priest since he already have been appointed as a deacon and he answered them crying as before that he had already been ordained as a priest. In the same year, they gathered on Sunday to make him a bishop for a diocese. St. Athanasius cried and begged them to leave him. 'You will be up for the position.' But when they insist him more intensively to accept, 'Let me tell you a secret.' He said, 'I am the patriarch Athanasios.' Abba Ilmefrian, who could not believe what he heard, fell on his face in shock. He cried, rolling over. 'Woe to me! I ordered my Patriarch Athanasius as a servant.' He say while crying. Bishops, priests, monks and lay people in the area were completely amazed by St. Athanasius' humble work. They brought the pulpit and carried him around singing. He consecrated the mass and conducted Communion, and there was great joy. The next day, they placed the saint on a beautiful mule, and Abba Ilmefrian traveled on foot (of his own accord) and reached Antioch with great singing. Saint Athanasius, the great shepherd, saved the church from being divided in this way. We celebrate this day becouse the saint died on this day

As mentioned in the Gospel, one of the 12 holy apostles is Saint Bartholomew. (Mat. 10:3) The holy apostle, like his other brothers, enlightened the world with the teachings of the Gospel. According to tradition, it was our Lord who gave him the name Bartholomew, which means 'one who waters plants'. Bartholomew left his agricultural work and became a disciple of our Lord Jesus Christ. The dioceses are Ilwah and Armenia. The throne of Armenia is also his. According to the holy man, he convinced the nations with his sermons and shocking miracles. He raised the dead, healed the sick, cast out demons and brought many back to life. It is said that Saint Bartholomew came to Ethiopia while he was teaching. Finally, King Agri was accused of teaching chastity to our wives, wrapped him in hair, filled with sand and threw him into the sea. He rested there.

Our Lady, in 5485 B.C., asked her father, Jacob, and her mother, Hana, 'Lebanon, come out.' She was conceived on August 7, according to reports. The history of the church explains in detail that she was born one day in May in a district called Lebanon. It is obtained through fasting and prayer. Because she was pure, she became God's companion. After this, Our Lady stayed at her parents' house for 3 years until she reached kindergarten. There was three years in the house of Abuha, and they were milked by Mary (according to Mary.) Jacob and Hannah lived for three years while raising their son and thanking God for all that He had done for them. by fasting Devoted to prayer, they gave alms to the poor and those who were fasting. When three years had passed when they had raised their daughter Virgin Mary in purity, Hannah said to her husband Iakim, 'Brother, let us give our child as a blessing to the house of God.' She said to him, 'Think that our daughter was not drawn to serve God, but to serve us in this world.' Jacob was happy when he heard this from his wife. As the prophet of God said, David, my son, listen and incline your ear, and build your family and your father's house, for the king / Christ / loves your beauty / your purity / Psalm 44:10-11. She was separated from her mother and father without getting used to grain and entered the Temple Torah on the third day of December at the age of three. It means the entry of the Virgin Mary into the temple.

Our holy father, Abune Zena, has traveled around the country of Shoa. Abune Zena Markos, father John, mother Maryam Zemeda /Deborah/. Their father, John, is the brother of Abune Tsaga Zeab, the religious father of Abune Teklehaymanot. Their mother is the sister of Abune Cristos. Abune Zena Markos is the father who was conceived by the evangelist St. Markos. On the third day of his birth, this father came down from his mother's arms and prostrated three times saying, 'Bow to the Father, bow to the Son, bow to the Holy Spirit.'' At the age of 40 days, when they took them to the church to be baptized, the priest delivered the rite of baptism orally. When they were baptizing them, they bowed three times saying that they bow to the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. At this time, the water boiled and his 72-year-old uncle Andrias saw this miracle and ran to the temple. The angel Saint Raphael said to him, what scared you, if you had anoint your baldness, hair would have grown after hearing this Andrias returned and anointed his bald head and his hear Grows. When Abune Zena Markos was 5 years old, his parents took him and gave him to a teacher. At the age of three, he studied the Old and new testament. When they returned, they were met by bandits at a place called Saint, and even their staffs were taken. Abune Zena Markos felt sad, and when they refer to God, their staffs turned into snakes and stung the bandits. When they were 30 years old, their family married him to a kind woman named Maryam Kibra and left them with a veil, hopping they could attempt to conceive. Abune Zena Markos said to her, 'My sister, this world is lost. What's the point of doing it?' She agreed and they leave the place at night. after ward angels brought Mariam Kibra to Gete-semane. She lived in there for 7 years and died on January 2nd. Then the lions buried her body. God, who pays the price, Gifted her with three crowns.

St. Andrew is the brother of St. Peter and is the first apostle called by the word of the Lord while he was fishing. John 1:35-45 Before following the Lord, he was a disciple of John the Baptist. Saint Andrew first began his preaching work in Palestine; According to Ausabius, who was a church historian, Andrew preached the gospel in Russia; Then he taught the gospel in Bithynia, Galatia, Romania, Macedonia, Asia Minor, Greece. It is said in church history that he founded the church of Constantinople and was the first archbishop of Constantinople; Finally, while he was teaching in a country called Mtra in Greece, the idol worshipers hung him on an 'X' shaped cross and stoned him to death on May 4th, 60 AD.

Abune Gebremenfes Qdus country is Nhisa (Egypt). Their father's name is Simeon and their mother's name is Akalias. They have been mourning for 30 years without a child. One day, when she entered the house of Aliyas and fell under the statue of the Trinity, she heard a voice saying, 'accept the son whose glory is greater than the height of the sky.' Accordingly, our father was conceived on the 29th of March and born on the 29th of December. When he opened his eyes, so that he could rest on something that could be seen, when he was born, he stood up and said, 'Thanks to Father, Thanks to the Son, Thanks to the Holy Spirit. When He rich three years old, the angel Saint Gabriel take him to Our Lady and the saints in heaven, and then took him to the monastery. Aba Zemedberhan, was told about the sign, and he have found him it to be a pure. The monk raised him and taught him and raised him to become monks. He was gifted of healing peoples. In one day he healed thousands of blind people and thousands of lame people. But latter, the bishops and the priests heard about their fame and came and asked them to pay taxes. Saint Gabriel seized him and brought him before the Lord. and lord guide him to focus in spiritual battle rather than physical one, since there are many who will be saved from hell of or death of soul, so separate yourself from people and enter the forest. May your life be with sixty Loins and sixty Tigers. and he said My lord, what do they eat and live? and God say's 'They will eat the dust that you stepped on and it will be enough for them'. They entered the Wasate Monastery and He started living with Lions and Tigers.

On this day, Our Lady, the Holy Virgin Mary, with her son, along Joseph and Selomoe, returned to their country after a heavy jurny for 3 years and 6 months in exile. When they returned from Egypt, our Lord was on the back of our Lady and pointed to Ethiopia with his enlightened fingers. Our Lady, my child, should you say, 'Why are you pointing your finger?' Your relatives will hang me and kill me, but those in this country believe me without seeing me. He gave it to her saying, 'Be proud of your tithe'. Tana lake at their feet. As they blessed Waldba and other places, a treatise on Urail and the miracle of Mary has been written extensively. Praise be to God who created our Lady from Hannah's womb and set her apart from the world of creation to be our mother's intercessor above all others.

'Hannah' means 'Gift of God' in Hebrew. Saint Hannah married the righteous Jacob from the tribe of Judah and gave birth to the Holy Virgin Mary, the mother of God, who was given a special gift of salvation for the whole world. Eight years before the birth of Christ, the mother of Bizat, Hana, rested on this day. A little later, her husband, Saint Yakem, followed her.

On this day, the chief of all the heavenly armies, the angel of counsel, is called the counsellor, who opens and closes the gates of the Holy Trinity, and intercedes for all creation. On the twelfth day of November, our church celebrates the feast of St. Michael the Archangel with great pomp. According to the teachings of our holy fathers, November 12th is the day when the great angel Saint Michael was appointed as the chief of the powers and tribal angels living in the fourth city of Ior. When God removed Satanel from his power and threw him to the earth because of his pride, Saint Michael was appointed in his place over the 99 tribal angels in the tenth city. (We find that he received this second appointment on April 2nd in our church book called Aximaros.) The appointment of St. Michael is not only on angels; But it also applies to those who are God's people. Among the churches that were planted in Addis Ababa, the first church is located in Shola. It was planted in the 4th century by Abrhana Atsabha and the ark came with the ark of Zion.

Blessed Abune Samuel Zeldba was born in Axum, Tigray, northern Ethiopia in 1295. His father was Stephen and his mother was Maryam. That they were God-fearing and praise worthy Christians, and that they later passed away as monks, is widely recorded in our father's Gedel Book and Sanksar. When the time of our father's vacation arrived, on the one hundredth year of his birth, he was separated from this world and then for his strength through the noise of the beasts, the demons, the heat of the day, the cold of the night, and the hunger and thirst. God came with the prophets, apostles, righteous and martyrs and repeated the promise he made to him while he was alive, by saying fo those who called your name, commemorated you, believed in your intercession in your prayers, pleaded with your barren bones in your grave, and entered into your family. He gave them a promise that they will too inherit the kingdom of heaven. Then His pure souls wes separated from his bodies by the hands of angels in the fragrant paradise. The holy angels, in the words of the prophet David, Ps. 116:15, saying, 'A glorious death for the righteous in the presence of God,' took her to her eternal resting place with loud singing, chanting, shouting and life. On the hundredth anniversary of his birth, our righteous father passed away on Tuesday, December 12 at nine o'clock in the afternoon, in Waldba Sangmantan.

‚ÄùSince all are to inherit salvation, aren't they spirits who are sent to help and serve?' Heb 1:14 'On the day of Zati, the teachers of the church ordered us to celebrate the feast of thousands of angels.'According to the tradition that our fathers and teachers made for us under the guidance of the Holy Spirit, the church celebrates the memorial festival of the myriad angels on the thirteenth day of November. Therefore, in this short article, we will briefly look at the interpretation of the names of the holy angels, their nature and their service for the purpose for which they were created in the Old Testament, the New Testament and the world to come.

In Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church The month Pagumen is considered as a memorial to the end of the world. Because of this, believers spend it in fasting and prayer. Especially on St. Raphael's Day, believers offer their prayers more than ever, believing that the heavens will open. They go to the rivers and bathe in the rain. As the coming of our Lord is remembered in the month of Pagumen, the hymns that are sung, the verses that are read, and the holy gospel that is also preached, show this mystery. Among the holidays that are remembered and celebrated in the month of Pagumen, every year on the 3rd day of Pagumen, the annual celebration of the Archangel Saint Raphael is celebrated in all Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo churches with a special spiritual ceremony. There are two reasons why the feast of St. Raphael is celebrated. One of them is because of the festival, and the other is the Mass. The meaning of the name 'Raphael' means 'pleasant, kind, merciful, sincere and gentle'. Archangel Raphael is one of the holy angels who constantly praise their creator God. 'I am Raphael, one of the seven noble chiefs' (Tobit 12:15).

eventName: Vergine Mary The covenant of mercy
Feast of the Blessed Virgin Mary

eventDesc: The great righteous Abune Habte Mariam was born in a place called Yerawi in Menz Auranja, whose father was Fr Brock and whose mother was Yostena, who lived in purity and sanctity. When they were going to a monastery to fulfill their mother's wish, a monk said, 'You are not allowed to be a monk, it is not allowed for you to enter the courtyard of this house, becouse you will ahve a chiled whose prayer is useful to the whole world, whose legacy will be talked about in the whole world since it's clean, who intercedes for the soul on earth, who will see the pulpit.' When the priest said 'God bless us' in the church, he also used to say 'God bless us and forgive us' in his children tongue. When he grew up, apart from learning good manners and keeping the law, he received monkhood at the hands of Father Samuel. When he left Abune Melek Tsadiq Monastery, he prayed for three months in a cave on the road. He also founded the monastery called Sebey, which is 2 hours away from Mount Lebanon, and the mostary is founded and named after him, Augest 26. His birthday is May 26 and He rest on November 26.

October 30th is the day the Apostle Saint Mark was born. April 30 is the day of his rest.  His mother's name is Maryam, she is one of the 36 saints. On the 50th day, the Holy Spirit descended upon the apostles while they were praying at the house of this holy mother. Acts 2;1 12;12; This apostle wrote his gospel in Rome in the 11th year of the Lord's reign in the Roman language. Although he followed St. Peter and St. Paul and preached the gospel in various places, he mainly traveled to Egypt and destroyed idols. He came to Ethiopia and preached the gospel. His seat is Alexandria, Egypt. Ethiopia has been importing 111 bishops from Egypt who were appointed by the See of Mark; On April 30th, idolaters killed St. Mark by dragging him with a bull. Let me tell you a little about the city of Debre Markos. After the bishop who was in this city cleansed the church of St. Mark, the country gathers to put in the ark. And the elders stood up and inaugurated the bishop saying, 'God bless you as our father built this parish for us.' But what made them laugh is that God made you a great person. Debar means a mountain.
